task.title: Enabling passwordless secure administration by using the command line
task.shortdesc: System administrators can enable passwordless secure administration of the appliance by using the command line.

context.p: You can configure passwordless secure administration of the appliance, by using the command: user sshkey add url. In the following formats, white space is added only for readability. Do not include any white space in the URL on the command line.

p.note: In a high availability environment, authorized_keys are not automatically replicated between the primary and standby nodes. Passwordless secure administration must be manually enabled on both the primary and the standby node.

step.cmd: Configure passwordless secure administration by using the command user sshkey add url. URL can be specified in one of the two following formats.

choice.p: For FTP or HTTP protocols, url is specified in the following format:

dlentry.dd: User name at the remote host.
Password for username at the remote host.
Remote host name or IP address.
Decimal port number of the remote server.
Absolute path for the remote file, prefixed with the 3 characters '%2F' or '%2f'. It is supported for protocol ftp and scp.
Relative path for the remote file. This path is relative to the default directory on the remote system. If username is specified, the default directory is typically the home directory of that user.
Name of the SSH public key file.

choice.p: For SCP protocol, url is specified in the following format:

dlentry.dd: User name at the remote host.
Password for username at the remote host.
Remote host name or IP address.
Decimal port number of the remote server.
Absolute path for the remote file, prefixed with the 3 characters '%2F' or '%2f'. It is supported for protocol ftp and scp.
Relative path for the remote file. This path is relative to the default directory on the remote system. If username is specified, the default directory is typically the home directory of that user.
Name of the SSH public key file.

taskbody.example: This example shows the setup of passwordless administration of the appliance by using a previously generated SSH key. admin@(none)> user sshkey add "scp://admin@192.0.2.0:Ëœ/.ssh/authorized_keys.pub" Adding ssh public key file for user admin Ok This example shows remote administration of the appliance, where a show imaserver command is issued:admin@<192.0.2.0>tmp]# ssh admin@example.com "show imaserver" version is 1.2 20140709-1000 [admin@<192.0.2.0>tmp]#
